subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Experiment 2 - RESULTS!
author: David Koenig
full_text:
The only way to assure a true test is to actually "TELL" a trusted source
what was done. Perhaps Frank?

On Mon, Jul 19, 2010 at 11:19 PM, <SnowfireL@aol.com> wrote:

>
>
>  you know Steve and Frank, maybe he has done some testing, and they have
> told him things similar to what they do for us, like exp. the color shirt he
> is wearing, a pets name, what type of bird it is, exp. "macaw."  What we
> know is that there is a place of Light, and a place of darkness over there,
> people ask all the time for help to go into the place of light.  Perhaps
> some of them are not allowed to cross just yet, maybe there are goofy's over
> there too that enjoy playing pranks, so they will say anything just to keep
> us talking to them, maybe they get lonely esp. when they happen to be
> "stuck" somewhere.  There are so many factors, and they are probably not
> able to see all, otherwise, we would all be rich from winning the lotto by
> now.  Even David claims the thing "is rigged." sf
>
>
>  -----Original Message-----
> From: Urkel23 <urkel23@aol.com>
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Mon, Jul 19, 2010 8:13 pm
> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Experiment 2 - RESULTS!
>
>
>
> I see a point that frank makes. For example, my file was very clear that
> said "marker". It doesn't mean that we are all nuts, that's the information
> that was given to us. It was a direct response to a question that i asked.
> It's not our fault that they gave me bad info, they probably didn't know the
> answer.
>
> I don't want to treat them like some retarded idiots over there, i wish to
> give them respect. The fact in my mind is that they are saying something and
> just because they didn't get your test right doesn't mean that it's any less
> fascinating to me that something talks that shouldn't. They probably could
> care less what's on your monitor.
>
> They are probably sitting there trying to figure out why you aren't doing
> anything yourself.
>
> -Steve H.
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> >
> > DAH! again. There's way to much expectation created in trying to guess,
> so
> > participants minds interfere with whatever spirit communication there
> might
> > be. You do not understand how this communcations works, nor do you
> > understand the effects of the observer, you can not seperate the observer
> > from the event in the pararnormal. therefore any results are
> invalid--before
> > you go puffing your chest out thinking how clever you are in debunking
> > spirit communication. Even your own expectation that no valid information
> > will be received is enough to block all information. But as usual,
> > skeptic/debunker ignore all!
> >
> > F-S
> >
> > On Mon, Jul 19, 2010 at 1:03 PM, <SnowfireL@...> wrote:
> >
> > >
> > >
> > > RJ. David insists you had an ink pen there, and "he changed it."
> > >
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: rasterer <rasterer@...>
> > > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>
> > > Sent: Mon, Jul 19, 2010 2:39 pm
> > > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Experiment 2 - RESULTS!
> > >
> > >
> > > Thanks to everyone who participated in Experiment 2.
> > >
> > > On Friday, 7/16/2010 I placed an object on top of my computer monitor,
> > > right in front of me, and left it there until noon Denver time on
> Monday,
> > > 7/19/2010. This experiment asked for participants to determine what
> that
> > > object was. Vague or partial answers would not be counted (for example,
> just
> > > giving a color, shape, size, what it's made of, etc): we're looking for
> what
> > > it is. Answers anyone reveals after noon Denver time Monday won't
> count.
> > > Participants can use their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or any other
> means
> > > they chose.
> > >
> > > In order to keep me honest, I took a picture of the object at the start
> of
> > > the experiment and loaded it to the Files section (RJ folder) of this
> group.
> > > The idea with this file is that you could download it at the beginning
> of
> > > the experiment and 'keep it safe' on your computer. Then at the end of
> the
> > > experiment, I would post the password so you can reveal the contents of
> the
> > > file. That way, you were in control of the original image during the
> entire
> > > time, not me.
> > >
> > > Passworded pdf:
> > > http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100716.pdf
> > >
> > > The password for that file is: 2plus2isFour
> > > Instructions, if you need them for the other files, are also in that RJ
> > > folder.
> > >
> > > So to the results:
> > >
> > > Number of participants: 6
> > > Total tries: 29
> > > Ambiguous answers: 0
> > > Correct answers: 0
> > >
> > > Object: Chair
> > > Object picture:
> > > http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100716.jpg
> > >
> > > As a little side experiment, on Monday I also asked if anyone had
> gotten
> > > any answers that might indicate an article of clothing (though I did
> not say
> > > why I was asking). One theory is that the human operator can be
> influenced
> > > by things they already know or suspect, and so interpret audio with
> their
> > > own personal 'educated guesses', that would differ from what they would
> hear
> > > had they not known those things. This side experiment did indicate some
> > > support for that theory, since before I mentioned 'articles of
> clothing', no
> > > one included an article of clothing in their results. But after I
> mentioned
> > > it, several reports of clothing began to appear. I did not add these
> tries
> > > to the results above.
> > >
> > > If anyone has any observations, comments, or ideas for improvement, let
> me
> > > know. Again, thanks to everyone who participated in this experiment.
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
>
>     
>
